channel.title: The Start Of Java-programming
channel.description:
Hello guys,
Basically I'm stuck in a dilemma, I've been wanting to get into Java programming for almost 2 years but for some reason I can't seem to understand it. I've read many tutorials on the forums to actually see if its sticking but its not at all. This is why I've resorted in asking you all what I could do now? Do you know of any other places I can explore; even the basics I'm not fussed, just anything. My dream would be to own my 317 RSPS with a thriving community, but my chances at the moment are pretty much slim to none. Any advice/help will be much appreciated.
Many thanks.

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Deci, post:8, topic:451689”]Would it help if I downloaded a Soruce and Client and just played around on it, and had a look at how everything functions? I’ve been trying to understand Java for a while now but it just doesn’t work for me; The concept doesn’t make sense, I don’t know where to start from etc.

Is there other guides which I could follow?[/quote]

If you want to learn about the 317 protocol look here.

Read full topic

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

Thenewboston is very vague in his explanations, I don’t recommend using his tutorials.

However he actually makes them in a professional manor, unlike most of the video tutorials I’ve seen, plus he also tries to explain it in terms that the average person without a ton of computer knowledge can understand. It also seems better than buying a book, the 3 books I’ve seen (one belonging to me and the other two to a friend) just kind of expect you to know allot about programming prior to reading, witch the OP clearly doesn’t.

[quote=“Deci, post:8, topic:451689”]Would it help if I downloaded a Soruce and Client and just played around on it, and had a look at how everything functions? I’ve been trying to understand Java for a while now but it just doesn’t work for me; The concept doesn’t make sense, I don’t know where to start from etc.

Is there other guides which I could follow?[/quote]
Isn’t that what I recommended from the beginning? -.- I learned 80% of what I know about both programming and VB.net from the videos thenewboston was hosting on his channel for someone.

Read full topic

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Look at code snippets, both in the source and on here from tutorials. I personally can’t explain how to observe code, you just do it.

I learned by just looking at code snippets, adding them in my source, and then I got curious to see what something actually did when I added it.

For example, look at this

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("slots")){ int hasitem = 25000000; int slot = (Misc.random(100)); int risked = (hasitem * 2); if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, hasitem)) { c.sendMessage("You havent got above "+hasitem+" gp in your inventory."); return; } if (slot == 11 || slot == 22 || slot == 33 || slot == 44 || slot == 55 || slot == 66 || slot == 77 || slot == 88 || slot == 99) { c.sendMessage("You pulled slotmachine and got "+slot+" You won "+(risked/1000000)+"M."); c.getItems().addItem(995, risked); } else { c.sendMessage("You pulled slotmachine and got "+slot+" You lost 25m."); c.getItems().deleteItem(995, c.getItems().getItemSlot(995), hasitem); } }
This is a command that adds a bare-bones ‘slot machine’ though commands.
Knowing that the item code for gold is 995, you can infer that any parts of the code with 995 in it have something to do with adding or removing gold.

But I’m no expert in Java, so you could try watching these
http://thenewboston.org/list.php?cat=31
He’s quite good at teaching the basics.

Read full topic

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Deci, post:3, topic:451689”]How though? If I don’t understand how they work. I’ve had better luck on Youtube with brief things such as; changing rights, adding commands, spawning npcs etc but a friend told me its useless without understanding the real concept. What would be your best advice for a person who knows nothing about programming?

Thanks for the reply.[/quote]

Buy a Java book, or torrent an e-book. Most of the youtube tutorials are bad, you can also try to create a simple program to kind of grasp the basics, i.e:
Create a simple program that prints numbers and text on screen.

Read full topic

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @runeherorsps runeherorsps
item.description:
@runeherorsps wrote:

best way is to look at tutorials on how to add different things. (good tutorials, which are well explained)
Such as adding new command or something like that. And try understand the code. Start with little things.

Read full topic

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @Deci Deci
item.description:
@Deci wrote:

How though? If I don’t understand how they work. I’ve had better luck on Youtube with brief things such as; changing rights, adding commands, spawning npcs etc but a friend told me its useless without understanding the real concept. What would be your best advice for a person who knows nothing about programming?

Thanks for the reply.

Read full topic

item.title: The Start Of Java-programming
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Experience is the best teacher to me, just look though a server’s source code and observe what each part of code actually does, then try implementing it into something custom

Read full topic
